title: Better than Feedly!
comment: This is the RSS news reader I've been waiting for. I've tried everything from feedly to feedbin and now that I discovered newsblur I can see why all the smartest people I know use it. It works offline, syncs quickly, and has a training feature to hide the crap I don't care about reading. Solid app.

title: Steep improvement curve
comment: I'm a Google Reader refugee. I tried loads of options but this was the one which I stuck to, and I've very happily paid up for Newsblur. Apple and Android apps started out being quite dubious but now I do half my (copious) reading on the go. Excellent interface. Thank you!!

title: Great
comment: Many updates which have helped to make it a brilliant supporting app.
Work great with the Web app

title: An excellent way to read Newsblur on the move
comment: The Android app had a rocky start, and felt for a while like an unloved part of the Newsblur family. But I'm pleased to say that it's now much matured, and is an excellent way to skim news whilst on the move.

title: Recent versions slow
comment: The feed is slow to update and there are no visual cues so you don't know when it is updated. The iPad version is still good, but the android app is borderline usable. I switched to inoreader (on the iPad as well)

title: Awful news sharing app.
comment: Lots of bugs and crashes a fair amount to the point where it basically doesn't work at all. This has been ongoing for more than a year with no solutions. Please fix and add features/improve content.

title: Stopped working
comment: Was working alright, but is now having trouble loading stories when I select an individual feed. Sits there loading forever.
Much improved
It used to work well, but now it will no longer load stories in the per-feed views.

title: Works for me
comment: Lot of people complain about NB, but I have been using it since Google Reader went offline and its always been working just fine.

title: Constantly crashing
comment: Was working great on my OnePlus One but is always force closing on the ZenPhone 2. Totally unusable.

title: Slow in loading stories
comment: You dropped support for Android Gingerbread for what ? I upgraded to a new phone running Lollipop and App still loading stories slowly.

title: Getting there
comment: The latest version crashes rarely and is mostly snappy

title: Greatest news reader on market!!!
comment: I use it everyday since Google shuted down GReader. It's actively developed and even opensourced on Github. There is web version and iOS app, so you are completely covered on all platforms. I cannot imagine my daily workflow without Newsblur :)  Try it, you won't regret it :)
Good looks and a quick reader. Works well!

title: Doesn't work well
comment: I love the desktop client, but the app works poorly. Feeds don't update at all in the background, and I usually have to back out and come back in to get them to refresh when I open an individual feed. Considering leaving, but nothing is better than the desktop client.

title: Excelente reader
comment: Pra quem se sente meio órfão de RSS, um dos melhores agregadores de conteúdo que já testei.

title: Bugs!
comment: Newsblur for free accounts has better behaviour than premium.

title: Buggy but worth it
comment: Every week or so I have to uninstall and reinstall for my unread stories to appear.

title: The best
comment: To get the most out of the app you have to spend some time on the website setting it up. Very easy to add and delete feeds, and their servers are very clever about finding files even with poorly formed feeds. Interfaces nicely with download mangers. Does a great job and stays out of the way.

title: What happened?
comment: Stories don't refresh since Feb. 15 update. :-/

title: Months of malfunctioning
comment: Even with multiple updates, still does not update the number of unread articles. About ready to uninstall.

title: Great news reader
comment: Latest update is snappy/fast. Thanks.

title: Was the best but...
comment: ... Latest android version shows no stories as unread.  If I switch the view to show 'all' I can see lots of unread stories, but no longer see new stories as they come in under 'unread'.
The best RSS feed reader I've found by far.

title: Mix of 2 character sets
comment: The ordering of right-to-left languages like persian will be permuted when it's combined with english characters.

title: Story count wrong, feeds do not update
comment: I used to be a big fan of this app. The last update did not fix the problems with feeds not updating and story counts being wrong. Will delete app if not fixed.

title: Don't install it
comment: It doesn't work very well with android 5.01. Crashes all the time.

title: January update fixed issues
comment: Latest version fixed the crashes (which as I suspected were db related).
training/focus is great, works well offline!

title: Improving
comment: Getting better.
4.1 update fixes many issues. A happy user once again

title: Jan 9, 2014 Update: great!
comment: New update fixes crash problems--back to the good old days.

title: Counts are wrong
comment: The overview page counts are always wrong.

title: Excellent news feed reader
comment: I loved the web interface and the android app is just as great.

title: Broken after update
comment: Unread number not accurate. Subscribed list not all showing. Was perfect before the upgrade.  Broken on LG G3 Av4 and nexus 7 Av5. Don't waste your time until it's fixed.

title: Good service, bad app.
comment: I really wish rate more stars. Last update keeps showing duplicate articles and marking as read randomly. I was forced to use news+

title: Update ruined it
comment: It wasn't great before the update but it was functional. Now it takes forever to refresh and is very slow and most likely will crash. Horrible app.

title: Doesn't work anymore
comment: Since the last couple updates, feeds no longer update, takes forever to sync, etc. Huge waste of time.

title: Update 4.x is garbage
comment: Wow, completely ruined the experience on all devices - nexus 7 and HTC one m8.  I am now actively looking for a replacement reader and feed aggregation system. Suggestions?

title: Offline syncing working great
comment: With about 30 min of testing, 4.0.2 appears to have resolved all issues I experienced since the 4.0 release!  Even with thousands of unread stories, the app is now highly responsive, prioritizing loading the particular feed or story I'm reading even when numerous global sync items remain.  No crashes or problems at all so far.  Very impressed and happy, thanks!!

title: Update ruined everything
comment: I've been using this app since Google reader went away. This newest update is the only issue I've ever had. It broke all of my feeds and won't sync.

title: Still Buggy
comment: Lots of problems with marking items read

title: Mostly this is an awesome app...
comment: It does very well in most aspects. A single glaring issue however  - the next button in story view is very very slow. And it seems to be randomly slow. Doesn't matter if you swipe or not though that does seem slightly faster.
Good

title: Used to be so good
comment: Now it just crashes constantly. Started about with the offline reading. I'm really disappointed.

title: Update issues
comment: Lag, sync issues, poor response times, and no search.  Please fix.
Great app !! But it have problem with right to left language!! Dear developers, please fix it!!

title: Offline mode is great
comment: Newsblur is just generally a joy to use, and offline mode speeds things up further. I look forward to future optimisations.

title: Still Lacking
comment: Any chances the app will include search? Inoreader (free) has search built in. Also, the UI is a bit clunky and not very clean.
Terrible

title: Great RSS reader
comment: Best of all that I have tried.

title: Stopped working
comment: The new version insists I have no new stories. Other Newsblur clients do show me the stories. Bring back the old version!

title: Looks great
comment: But it doesn't say in the description that you have to create a username and password.  Not my thing.
The ability to read offline and dark theme (with all of the original features) make this one of the best rss readers
Y U No Google+ Single Sign On?!
Wait list? Uninstall.

title: Sweet app bro
comment: I switched from Google Reader to a Newsblur paid subscription. I follow about 100 feeds and check them on my desktop, and on my nexus 4 using this app (and my nexus 7.)  Feature-wise, this app is perfect for me- it does what I want (including easily sharing to Instapaper), and the features I don't want to use are easy to avoid.

title: great
comment: Great RSS reader

title: Great app getting lots of improvements
comment: Newsblur is awesome and knowing everything is open source makes everything fantastic. This app always gets frequent updates making it better and faster. And that is while the developer added search to the Web interface how does he find the time to do everything!! . Simply amazing :) keep up the  good work! Edit: recent update makes me want to read everything using it!! thanks
Now superfast

title: Offline reading and night mode FTW
comment: Great service and app. v3.5 sped things up quite a bit. v4 just added offline and night mode. Constant improvement from the author. Love it!
Force closes on start in Lollipop
Crashed without even logging in
Great app, crashes in lollipop though

title: Crashes on startup on lollipop (5.0).
comment: Was 5 stars before.

title: Crashes on start up on Lollipop
comment: Currently Unusable. Bummer as I previously used this app daily and enjoyed it.

title: Android lollipop (5.0) crash
comment: Love this app but unusable on Android lollipop (art?) please fix!

title: Awesome reader!!!
comment: I use it everyday, it's just perfect, you can train it to hide articles you don't want, and that feature is life saver!!!

title: Force close central
comment: Must suck to suck so badly.

title: The perfect no-frills feed reader
comment: Finally an RSS reader that just gives you your feeds and doesn't muck about trying to be fancy. This is excellent and still actively developed.

title: Super
comment: Good app. But change you icons in drawable folder. Very large in xhdmi 5'

title: Perfection.
comment: This app has so many things going for it I wouldn't even know where to begin. If newsreading of feeds is important to you, this is the way to go.
Use it daily

title: Not user friendly but still great
comment: One of the best rss readers out there. The text view (works like instapaper) and filtering content by tags and authors is great. You have to stick to it for a while to learn how to personalize it best. It sits right there with the gReader.     UPDATE : Please make sharing to Instapaper, Pocket and Evernote more easy by integrating it right into your interface (of you cannot provide offline reading). While the text view is great and the interface clutter free, functionality is far from good.

title: Only missing 2 things...
comment: A dark theme and offline mode. Otherwise its flawless.

title: Innovative, but needs Offline
comment: I have longed for a newsreader that allowed me to filter the stories based on keywords, weeding out the types of posts I knew I wouldn't read from an otherwise good feed. This is an excellent feature, and wonderful to base a service around.  My only complaint is there is no "mobilized offline" for the client, downloading articles and running them through Readability or Instapaper to save the full article with images to the client.

title: Excellent app
comment: Great and use it daily but I would love a dark theme for the app to make reading in the dark a little easier on the eyes.

title: Almost perfect
comment: Need to be able to tag saved stories from mobile; otherwise has everything I need.
Loved it

title: Buggy ugly mess
comment: The signup flow is a series of nonsense. The styling looks like no one cared. The app crashed within my first 5 minutes. I wanted to give Newsblur a chance, but if this is the effort you've put into this app, what impression does that give me of your product?

title: About ready to give up on Newsblur
comment: Every day I get mixed up links to stories I want to read. I'd love for Newsblur for Android to show an unread count on it's icon. Note 2.
Excellent clutter free news reader

title: Good start
comment: It's a good RSS reader and getting better.

title: Nice on my Nexus 7 (1st gen.)
comment: No problems. Great for keeping up with my feeds when I am away from my PC.

title: Useless
comment: Couldn't even make an account. Tried about 15 random usernames and they all came back as in use. Then finally, it resorted to claiming there was a network error preventing registering. Useless.  Uninstalled.
Got this as a replacement for Google Reader; turns out it's so much better!

title: I was looking for a good, found perfect
comment: I loved Google's RSS reader. But... What is it called again? I don't recall. It doesn't matter now that I found NewsBlur. NewsBlur has intelligence training, has an active community, has powerful UI. My life is now divided: before-NewsBlur and after-NewsBlur. I love NewsBlur.

title: Um
comment: No widget

title: The best reader
comment: Simply the best. Missing two things though. 1. The ability to add a focus from within the app. 2. Feature to add feeds by inputing an URL and not only by search.

Needs more features of the desktop version.  Where are the global shared stories?  I don't feel like I'm getting all of my feeds on mobile.  No way to discover new content once all feeds are read.  Otherwise, good substitute for Google reader.

title: I use this app daily
comment: Fast smooth simple what's not to love.  Love to see ability to unsubscribe immediately when reading the third boring post of a blog.

title: Best in class
comment: Easy to use and very solid
Great update!

title: Come a long way
comment: I was horrified like many when Google Reader went down, but Newsblur has been a fine replacement and always getting better.   Thank you for working so hard on it.
New layout is terrible and no option to turn it off. Time to try a new reader, shame they had just fixed the other faults

title: Much improved
comment: Fast to load and navigate. Rarely has any issues. Excellent service.

title: Awesome app.
comment: Small app that does a lot of things well.

title: Efficient,
comment: however i think there are few options in the application to customize the environment as desired.  but it's quite an efficient app for my daily use.

title: Essential!
comment: I use newsblur several times a day to keep up with dozens of feeds.  Can't live without it. Worth every penny and much more.

title: Much improved
comment: Originally a bit clunky but has matured into an excellent way of reading news and keeping it synchronized across devices.
Needs work

title: Useless
comment: Doesn't consistently update feeds. Ignores some feeds altogether. Fails at its core purpose. Do not use.

title: Not user friendly
comment: Can't get it working.

title: No longer supported?
comment: I had this app on my Droid Incredible 2 as recent as 3 days ago. I had to factory reset my phone for a bunch of issues and now it says this app is no longer compatible with my device. WTH?

title: Needs lots of work
comment: Paid account. Does not always synchronize properly. Slow to load.  Crashes frequently.  Very slow fixing problems.

title: Was good
comment: Now Great.  Update fixed all.

title: New issues
comment: Sometimes won't let me swipe to next unread when many articles in feed. Some read articles still show as unread temporarily. Article font too small now.

title: The work is appreciated
comment: It's starting to feel pretty snappy, and the text size enhancement is great. A few small additions like better video embedding, long-press options on links, and image alt text would push this to a 5 star app.

title: A feed reader that intelligently automates drudgery
comment: I love the overall "Google reader replacement" aspect of this app and the newsblur site. The android app has come a long way and risen above shortcomings.  I reserve the last star for some persistent refresh issues that occur when reading long post lists.
It's only missing an offline download.
The service is great but the app is really slow loading the feeds

title: An OK news reader app
comment: I had high hopes.  The web interface is pretty nice.  But the app ends up feeling a little clunky.

title: Great service.
comment: Excellent!

title: Much, much better
comment: I love this reader platform. And now the Android application is usable. For some reason when I occasionally try to save a story, I will get an error message. But when I immediately try again, it works.  Strange. Other than that minor nuisance, I wish there was functionality to "train" stories on the mobile app,  but that's not that big a deal.    Highly recommended.  Update Jan-14:  Rarely a problem with the app these days.  Updates have been great.

title: My Reader replacement
comment: Great RSS reader. Just knocked one star off just because I think it has room to grows in terms of ui polish. E.g. Android Holo theme would be a nice touch.

title: Good Google Reader Replacement
comment: Very good Google Reader replacement on Android and PC - good sharing, saving for later and filtering.  Would be good to be able to mark folders read or select multiple stories as read.

title: Decent Google Reader replacement
comment: Much less crash-happy and streamlined than feedly, but hogs a lot of data. Cannot see any options for download on wifi only. No long-press options when opening links. It would also be nice to be able to reload an item when it didn't download right. UPDATE: crashing has been fixed with recent updates.
Love it. Simple, effective RSS reader

title: Error loading stories
comment: Keep getting this error. :(

title: Love this app
comment: Not sure why read all stories keep saying error loading I only get 10 stories now after the update.. Help I love this app and would love to give it 5 stars

title: Work done to make it faster
comment: I no longer experience as much lag as I used to - good job! I'm being picky in not giving 5 stars because I'd like to adjust font sizes to make them smaller.

title: Great RSS reader.
comment: Developer updates app all the time, taking user feedback into consideration. Totally worth the $2 a month I pay for it!

title: Newest update fixed the problem
comment: Several past updates had a toast message that wouldn't go away, but it's fixed now. Thanks for a great app!

title: Great RSS reader
comment: Latest version unfortunately buggy...
Simple and smoth

title: Runs great!
comment: I use it all the time to keep up with my blog sites. Was using Pulse previously, and found this easier to navigate and mark read stories.

title: Retrograde update x2
comment: Some posts now not displayed when opened, setting these to unread crashes the app.  Poor QA. Still happening on 7th Jan update.

title: Great app
comment: After Google discontinued reader, I could not find an rss reader for my phone that worked any where near as good.  Newsblur is very close and I am pretty happy with it but lately I keep getting this message near the bottom of the screen that says "error loading stories" and it doesn't go away even after I close the app. Also when I am in the app scrolling through news items and I get this message, it loses my place. Please fix. I can't find an rss reader for my phone I like except this one!
Works fine

title: What are you complaing about????
comment: No bugs, it's stable, has a nice UI, easy to use, the app can even be accessed when offline. ------ You're comparing it to Google Reader??? You much more want to be spied on and have your privacy shamelessly ripped off??? ---- NewsBlur works great for me. Why don't you update yours?

title: I love it
comment: Simple, fast but doesn't support RTL  (nexus 4)

title: Great reader
comment: It's worth paying for.

title: Very buggy
comment: Since the January update this app is practically unusable.
Saved stories

title: Great app
comment: Since last rewrite with new stack a lot (seriously a lot..) of bugs are present. Dont wait for a big update to fix them all, do lots of smaller once often cause now its kind of a deal breaker... Try swiping between Posts in a feed and ser what happens :)  Five stars though just plz update faster.

title: Best mobile reader
comment: Newsblur is an awesome service and this app allows me to take it with me.

title: Buggy.
comment: Skipping news, broken refresh button icon.

title: First Impression - Buggy
comment: Added one feed using the app. Read all of the articles and it showed -3 for the total for that feed. Hit the feed title to re-enter the article list and a message dialog popped up saying "Error loading feed." It took a minute to disappear from my screen, even after closing the app. Also, if you're allowed to create categories in the mobile app I'm missing where that is.

title: Good RSS reader, made by someone who reads RSS so understands
comment: Came to this after trying 5 other popular alternatives which were just to fussy.  This is fast,  and gives straightforward feeds with no fuss and very easy click to get original story/site. Feedback is listened to and changes made. It keeps improving. Still adding features and latest update speeds everything up.

title: Latest update is broken
comment: Latest update is glitchy and marking feeds as read while moving through articles before you see all of them. Normally a 5 star app.
Did not work

title: Fantastic!
comment: Best RSS reader service out there, especially for power users. Thanks!

title: The best feed reading app there is!
comment: Certainly as easy one to recommend to any person with more than a few feeds.

title: Best Newsreader
comment: I have been using Newsblur since the death of Google Reader. as much as i hated to see Google reader go, it gave the smaller devs with awesome services line Newsblur a chance in the light. This Android app was rough around the edges in previous versions but since day 1 always worth using. With this new release its truly great. The app is great to use and i have very few issues.   I still think Newsblur is the best cross platform news aggregation and reading service out there, and even if Google started Reader back up, i would stay with Newsblur.

title: 直覺，好用
comment: 感覺跟以前Google Reader很像，所以我很放心。雖然後來的閱讀軟體功能都很新很棒，但這樣反而讓我覺得很累，因為要從新習慣。

title: Perfect
comment: NewsBlur isn't just the perfect replacement for Google Reader - it's even better. Thanks for adding "mark as unread" option!
Boring so-called news.

title: Not ready for prime time
comment: Cumbersome to setup, default feeds are generally lame, and hangs up. I don't like Flipbook, but it's certainly better that Newsblur. Uninstall until it matures... If it does.
It doesn't even let me register! It says server problem!

title: Very bad.
comment: Android version. Cant even load anything...

title: Crapware
comment: Asks for registration upon first use, which is apparently necessary to use the application. Of course there is no way this is really necessary or useful for the application to work. It's just more information harvesting by the so-manieth crapware producer. Immediately uninstalled this, there are better and less intrusive alternatives.

title: ExGoogle Reader
comment: Although there are some missing features, such as download for off-line reading, it's the best alternative to Google Reader.
My replacement to the shutdown of Google reader

title: Works very well.
comment: I can't think of things I would do to improve this although there must be something. It does what I want and quickly. It has the controls and is easier to use than all the others I have tried. Big thumbs up!

title: Gets the job done, some nuisances
comment: - No way to turn off comments from others, they crowd the view. - Take a long time to load stories; they rarely seem to be ready to read for me.

title: Best I've found
comment: Ever since the death of Google reader, the newsblur website has been my favorite replacement. Its various view options, including text, work really well. Now that the app has text view and simplified sharing, the app gets 5 stars. Best out there.

title: Good replacement for Google Reader.
comment: Works well, love the only show unread items... Not much else to say.  If you use news blur service, this app compliments it nicely.  ** Edit ** As of version 3.0, the buttons to go between stories doesn't seem useful, as you can just swipe left to right.  Seems like they are just kind of in the way.

title: Thanks
comment: Simply the only service/app that lived up to replacing Google Reader

title: Wasted download
comment: The app seemed to function great but when I received the welcome email I clicked the option to opt out of mail & it takes me to the sign up for premium page asking for credit card info. Developers that is a lame idea, not only will I not pay premium but I deleted the app & will urge all my friends to switch

title: Slow to load
comment: Possibly because I didn't want to pay 24USD  but didn't bring through any news even on wifi

title: Best news reader/service I've found.
comment: The last update really helped. I'm glad Google reader went away. Newsblur is great.

title: Best RSS Reader since Google Reader!
comment: After Google Reader was retired, I started looking for an alternative, and ultimately picked Newsblur. Definitely the best RSS Reader available.

title: Really impressed with the app
comment: I've used NewsBlur since Google Reader died, and I've been more or less happy with the web version. Since learning that there was an app, however, and indeed one so well-designed as this one, gives it five stars. Really pleased with this app and how smoothly it integrates with the NewsBlur website service.

title: Pretty good
comment: Pretty, pretty, pretty, pretty... pretty good.

title: OK
comment: Slow to sync, awkward to read original story in browser.  Wanted one RSS service for PC android and iPod but iPod needs iOS 7 and my two year old iPod won't run it so I'm still looking for an RSS service.

title: For the power user
comment: Will admit that this doesn't look as pretty as some other news readers.  But that is not the point. Newsblur  has more features than other news readers I have tried, and all are definitely geared towards folks who have lots of subscriptions and like to power through those feeds.   It does have most of the functionality and a more. I like the "learning feature" that allows you to mark an article, choose a tag or author you tend to always read. This brings those articles up front and center as it lists a total of those next to the total of unread.   I found Newsblur in the infamous Google reader shutdown. I liked the free version so much that I paid the developer for the "plus features". Have never regretted that. (no the app is still free, the subscription applies to your account).
Replaced my google reader. I'm more than happy with the result. Bettrr than google reader for me!

title: Miss reader, best replacement
comment: Newsblur is the best replacement I found for Google Reader in general. The Android app is not fully mature yet but it's getting close.

title: Neglected
comment: Almost 3 months since this app was updated, while the iOS app has received several major updates. Simple things like un-saving a story doesn't even work on Android. Wouldn't have bought a subscription if I knew this was their attitude towards Android.
Free and good RSS reader, what more do you want?

title: All shared stories not loading
comment: The option of 'All shared stories' doesn't load on the mobile version though I am able to see them on the Web. Please fix this.

title: Best Google Reader replacement
comment: I miss treader to death, but NewsBlur is a great replacement with an active development team.

title: Bad experience with a bad connection
comment: There should be a way to automatically download feeds while the app is not running, so internet access isn't required.

title: Not that good
comment: Your desktop app is awesome, but the mobile app not so much. I am really really hoping you are working on that.

title: Great...
comment: Great, but it a widget would make it even better!

title: Decent and improving
comment: I love the Newsblur web app; the Android app doesn't measure up. There's no way to change the order of posts, and it frequently doesn't mark posts as read. But the developer is both responsive and committed, and I trust these will be addressed soon.   *Update* Continues to improve. Can now read stories in multiple orders, can make and favorite comments without crashing, and can access shared posts. Only complaint is that read shared posts still show up in count on both Android and Web app.

title: Solid RSS Client
comment: NewsBlur is the replacement for the dearly departed Google Reader.  Feedly is nice enough (and Feedly will serve as your central cloud feed storage), but NewsBlur gets the news reader interface right.  If you liked Google Reader's simplicity and straightforward style, I very much recommend checking out NewsBlur.

title: It's good
comment: I like it.

title: Average
comment: Have to go back to the menu after every five articles as a throttle on the free account. Unfortunately, the asp frequently re-lists articles I've just read, do I find myself going back to the main screen every 3 or so articles. Deleting feeds on the app does nothing. Must delete on web to remove a feed. Freezes about once per day for me. However, its a simple reader, something that other readers are moving away from, much to my frustration.

title: Not Good
comment: Crashes often. Don't see any of my Google Reader labels. Loads stories very slowly.

title: Finally good!
comment: It took a little while, but it's finally reached a point where I'm satisfied with it. It's much faster now in loading and refreshing the feeds, which was my main complaint. Now if only I could paste a feed URL in, to subscribe to it.

title: Not all stories load
comment: Now only showing a few stories at a time and I have to go out and back in to see a few more etc. I think this is because they want me to purchase the expanded version but I see no option to do that on the phone. I'll keep using it because I don't have an alternative but this is a bummer.

title: Great reader replacement
comment: Excellent app and service.

Thank you. Finally with version 2.1 you managed to release a truly usable app	Newsblur , probably the best reader but Android development was pretty much behind. I almost thought that you where losing me, an early adopter of Newsblur.  There is still room for improvement. Why does the app not show me that I have read everything, instead I keep getting to swipe to the next article which isn't there...  But these are small improvements and the Android Newsblur app is finally mature and I am happy! ;-)

title: Best rss reader
comment: I was dreading replacing my Google reader but this is fantastic! Pairs well with the amazing "Listener" Launcher as well.

title: Excellent
comment: I miss using the volume keys to move to next/prev story like Google reader did on my nexus 7. But great app

title: Screw Google! Newsblur is much much better!
comment: Word!

title: terrible
comment: Wait list? Seriously? I'm not going to pay for your stupid app just so that I can have it right now.  Instead, I'm going to find a DIFFERENT app that I can have right now. Uninstalling.  Also, the signup interface is clunky and cluttered on my phone.

title: New update is a big improvement
comment: "Mark as unread" option=jump from 4 to 5 stars!
Really slick

title: To basic!
comment: The app is "simple," yes... but that's all really.   At this time I miss the features the Google-reader had.  1 such "simple" feature would be the ability to delete a saved story. In this app, something as simple as "delete this saved story" is unavailable.   Furthermore, feed management is most limiting also.   I wish furthermore that there would be a "search within feeds" option, that allows you to pull any particular feed from among those to which the app allows you to subscribe...   So very limited!

title: Does the job
comment: Not as good as Google Reader in terms of user experience, obviously because the team aren't as big as Google, but they seem like they're trying their best to improve it unlike Google, and it does the job well enough so I'll keep using it.  My biggest request right now is to have the stories avaliable offline

title: Multiple serious problems
comment: Using this on a Galaxy Note 2. It acts as though most of my feeds don't have unread items even though they do, it randomly marks items as unread, fails to properly unsubscribe from feeds, and will not display more than one feed at a time. Trying to load more (like a folder of three feeds) it just sits there forever trying to load. This is essentially unusable. I waited to write this review but there have been a few updates and it's still just as bad. Uninstalling.

title: Good at the limited things it will do
comment: In terms of what it can do, I like the reader overall, but it's not going to be a long term solution for me. The problem is that it will not import OPML files, nor will it find about half of the feeds I subscribed to on my other computer. I'm not sure what the problem is, but it won't find them using titles and it won't let me put in a feed URL. So, I'm missing most of my news updates. Not good. I'm still looking.

title: Decent but missing features from webapp
comment: It had gotten much better, but I'm still waiting for them to implement features from the webapp such as viewing the feed or having it fetch the full text of the story.

title: Good for google reader émigré
comment: Only complaint: links to stories don't look like links.

title: Not setting read on read posts.
comment: As title, when reading all my posts only a few of them get set as read.

title: Good service; reasonable app
comment: Would like to alter the feed order in android app.

title: Great replacement for Google Reader
comment: Great support. Thanks for the quick Nexus 7 fix.

title: Great Reader Replacement
comment: News blur is more than just an app, it's a full replacement for the Reader backend and it rocks. The intelligence trainer is worth the price of admission alone.

title: Terrible for tablets
comment: I tried using this app on my Xoom. There are no fragments, just one big list that takes up the whole screen. The tablet experience was so bad, I immediately deleted my NewsBlur account, since The Old Reader does everything I need /and/ has an Android app that works.

title: Love NewsBlur, but this needs offline sync
comment: I just never open it, cause I have to wait for everything. Take the time to add good sync.

title: Crashes
comment: Just crashes after entering login details.

title: Version 2.1 crashes on startup on Nexus 7
comment: It was working fine before, but now I can't use the app. Frustrating, since I'm a paying customer.  I'll update this review after it's fixed.

title: Doesn't work on Nexus 7 after update
comment: As other comments have shown, is clearly hasn't been fully tested. You really need to do testing otherwise you will loose your customer base very quickly especially as there is an annual subscription available!  Please update or revert to the older version quickly otherwise I will have to look at alternatives!!  Thanks

title: Seems nice but...
comment: crashes at launch on nexus7 after it aksed for login :-(

title: Crashes!
comment: Just after installing, I tried to register a new account. The app repeatedly crashed before it could even finish registering.

title: Fantastic
comment: I love Newsblur. It has been my Google Reader replacement and works wonderfully. The developer is constantly updating and listening to users. Perhaps most importantly, the service is open source. The latest Android update added mark as unread which finally sealed the deal for me.

title: Easily replaces Google Reader now
comment: ETA: 7/4/2013 @ 11:03 a.m. - Totally excellent.  I am now completely pleased.  24 dollars for a Reader that essentially effortlessly replaces my Google Reader experience that I have relied upon to keep up with the internet.  Thank you thank you thank you!!!! Oldest to newest added!!! That's responsive!!!  ###First review: I must have sorting from old to new.  This new to old is unacceptable and simply won't do.  The 24 dollars I spent for a year's subscription will hopefully encourage the development of this app to include such ability.  Everything else about it rocks.  Very simple.  Happy to support this app and would even buy it, but stays at two stars, since I simply cannot use the mobile app.  Sorry, I am OCD about my RSS feed reading...###

title: Great progress!
comment: 2.1 is the first version that loads all stories for someone with lots of feeds like me. Great to see the improvements, keep them coming!

title: Featureless
comment: Moved from greader and have been very disappointed about missing features. Update: some more features are coming in... Keep it coming!

title: Works nicely
comment: Some times things don't get marked as read in the folder view, but it looks like things are marked correctly on the server.  Article retrieval is faster then the last version.

title: No Widgets
comment: So far this works well enough but I miss my ticker widgets from previous readers

title: Everything is much better
comment: The app and your website are much better overall and will serve as my Google reader replacement!

title: Needs work
comment: App got stuck at "Loading stories...". Maybe a server issue? Seemed to fix itself while I was typing this.  The ability to paste feed URLs into the Add New Feed box would be useful.  Lacks a lot of the features Google Reader had and that Freely now has, eg. different view styles.

title: Display and mark as read random
comment: Pity because the web site is great.

title: Best so far
comment: Closest to Reader so far, works great on PC and GS3. Only complaints are no way to mark as unread, and John C. Dvorak feed keeps reappearing even though I constantly delete it.

title: Great app.
comment: Great app.

title: Fast
comment: Looks like Windows 95, but it's fast and intuitive. Better navigation behavior than Feedly. Looking forward to seeing this app develop.

title: Doesn't show feeds
comment: Like so many others that have come to NewsBlur, I pulled in my Google Reader account. On the NB web site, I can see all my feeds. On the app? Not a sausage. App is totally useless to me.

title: No tablet mode
comment: Please implement 2-pain view mode like iPad version.

title: if you're looking for a Google Reader replacement, this is it
comment: Newsblur on the web has always been good. This app had improved drastically.

title: Just missing widget
comment: Everything I wanted, just missing a full screen widget like Google reader had.

title: Not working properly
comment: I've tried this app twice and it's just not working. Garbled text and problems adding subscriptions. I really want to like this. Maybe I'll try again when it's fixed...I've been  searching for a good google reader alternative app. Checked out a bunch..but so far.. :-\  .,

title: Buggy, poor quality
comment: Newsblur itself is great but the app is terrible. It frequently hangs up trying to load content, it is completely hit or miss with marking items as read and you can't mark anything unread. Performance is terrible - I don't think the app does much I'm the way of caching as it seems like it has to reload stuff constantly.   I'm a total news junkie and I joined Newsblur upon hearing about the imminent closure of Google Reader. I spend a lot of time being frustrated with this app compared to Reader.

title: Sucksass
comment: Bait and switch for paid services. Blows as a reader

title: Works great
comment: I already used this website know my desktop and I just plugged my account into my tablet and it works great!!!

title: Great update!
comment: App has gotten better and better with each release.  Thanks to the dev for the great work.

title: Mark Unread
comment: This really needs to be an option. Seems like it would be incredibly easy to implement.

title: No real control of RSS
comment: No way to mark as unread anything! No night theme, no real customising UI. Have to find something better.

title: Getting better
comment: I like the website much better than other services but the app, while improved with better sorting, still can't compete. Need google/instapaper mobolizer to see truncated feeds without going to the website.

title: My choice
comment: Easy and fast scanning app

title: Good but needs in-app viewer
comment: I like it overall but opening chrome every time I want to view a full article is a non starter for me.

title: Works fine but..
comment: You guys really need a dedicated ui designer to conform with the droid design specifications.

title: Much better!
comment: Changed my review from 2 to 4 stars after recent update, great work and works like a dream now. Only reason it isn't a 5 is because I'm not a huge fan of the layout.

title: Looks nice
comment: Unfortunately, takes absolutely forever to sync my feeds. Doesn't seem to be a back-end problem, because Blar syncs just fine.  EDIT: each update announcement is voiced along the lines of "yay, it's not shit anymore, check it out".  Move along, still unusable.  I'm especially curious as to what's the deal with the aggregated views: the app has already fetched all the individual feeds, what is it _doing_ for minutes (yes, really, minutes) when I select "All stories" (say)?

title: Nice companion for the website
comment: Newsblur fills the void left by Google Reader, and then some. This app is improving in leaps and bounds, with significant updates to UI and functionality. The devs deserve a lot of credit for their achievements to date. The app works great as it stands... There are always nice-to-have things that would be there in an ideal world, but, on past performance, I'd say give them time, and you'll get them. Five well-deserved stars.

title: A reasonable start.
comment: It's okay. But still has a long way to go. Clunky UI, no mobilise view, no offline sync. Just way too basic.

title: Great update
comment: The latest update is great. Finally can set it to only show unread items. Feels a little bit faster too, but that could just be me.

title: Good app, but needs better sorting.
comment: As a paid customer, I use newsblur on iOS, windows 8 RT, Chrome, and Android, which has finally reached feature parity with iOS!
Much improved

title: Needs a better tablet ui
comment: Getting a little better.

title: Good but lacks polish
comment: Works well overall but missing features like marking as unread. Also likes to say it's updating but doesn't until you exit.

title: Needs work
comment: No way to sort old first or mark an article unread. Web interface is better, but without the mobile app not worth $24/year for service

title: Decent app but could use improvement
comment: Like other reviewers have stated, this is a decent app, but a few key features would make it better: fixing the bugs that cause it to crash, sorting oldest to newest, and making unread.
Really needs "mark as unread" option!

title: sign in fail
comment: doesn't recognize any of my registration  sign in id  and there are no alternatives to correct the problem...uninstall

title: Slow, poor UI
comment: No tablet interface on my Nexus 7 in landscape. No way to mark article as read without actually going into it?   No swiping in Article List view???

title: Not as good as the website
comment: Can't quite do all the things you can do on the website site. Also, syncing of "read status" is spotty.

title: Google
comment: like apps

title: Interface is terrible, lacks options
comment: At least give us a black theme and mark as read when you scroll past a post.

title: Google Reader Replacement
comment: For the past couple of months I've used a handful of RSS Readers that will work as a replacement to Google Reader... this is by far the best one yet.  It has many similarities, as well as many new and better features. .

title: Need an unread button and sort
comment: It would be very handy if there was an unread button like the google reader app. I use the unread button when I want to come back to an article when I am on my desktop. Also I can't seem to find the setting to make it show the oldest items first.

title: Love the service, hate the app
comment: Newsblur is a great replacement for Google reader, but this app is frustratingly bad. It takes forever to update the feeds, and it seems like it lacks a lot of functionality.

title: Not many features
comment: The app does its job I suppose, but that's about it. No many features at all. Not even sort from old to new.
Better than feedly

title: Good but the UI isn't up to par with iOS.
comment: This app works way better than before. I love the product and the developer and will gladly continue to pay for the service. I will upgrade the rating to five stars as soon as the android version of the app gets the UI update and all the functionality of the iOS version.

title: Sempooooii
comment: The best
New version mo betta.

title: good app but
comment: it's a good app but i have proplem with some arabic site i didn't have this issue with google reader the problem in the articles with arabic and english the arrangement of the article is not right and it's impossible to read it correct this issue is on both pc and android can you solve this please thanks !!

title: Android share
comment: Would really like to have an Android share action provider in addition to newsblur sharing. I like to save things to pocket by sharing an item to it.

title: Excellent companion
comment: Maybe not the prettiest newsreader app but it's very efficient quick and isn't a memory hog. Serious news reader users with a need for a genuine fully fledged and stand alone alternative to Google reader will love it. Unlike all the others this doesn't rely on Google reader at all. The desktop version is brilliant.

title: It's come a long way
comment: I chose NewsBlur after Google Reader decided to shutdown.  At first the huge influx of traffic made the site unusable, but now it's pretty fast.  I had issues with articles not updating on the website, which was quickly resolved after an e-mail or two.  The android app had a similar issue which was resolved before I could even write an e-mail about it.  So NewsBlur has had a bumpy start, but it's turned into a better RSS reader than reader ever was.  The creator is quick to fix problems, receptive to ideas for change, and just a nice guy.  I have no doubts that NewsBlur will just keep getting better.

title: Poor
comment: Works well enough now

title: No access to every RSS feed?
comment: I can find no way to subscribe to an RSS feed that is not part of the Newsblur 'backend.'  One upon a time RSS was open.  Now, it seems no reader gives open access to all feeds.  I mark this app as average, simply because it's no worse than anything else.

title: Seems to be the best replacement for Google Reader
comment: I like Newsblur a lot. After trying (and not liking) Feedly, I wanted to find a well reviewed RSS hosting service that could replace Google Reader. Newsblur seems to be run by someone from his house. But he's doing a great job. The Android app could use some work. The folder sorting does not match the folder structure you use in the web version until after you install the app (so if you are a new user, get settled in the web version first before installing). I was a long time GReader Pro user, and I liked how quickly you could scroll through all unread messages and mark previous ones as read as you scrolled. This app almost forces you to view items by folder, and mark all as ready before proceeding to the next folder. I'm used to the new workflow. I hope performance gets better with each new release. A good start!

title: Feed limit
comment: NewsBlur would be the best but the limit of 64 feeds makes it useless for me.

title: Great app, one feature request though
comment: It seems there isn't a way to add a specific feed, the "add feed" functionality assumes you want to search for a feed but I want to add a specific rss feed, by URL.  Can this functionality be added? I believe the Web version has the same issued.

title: great service, ok app, ios version *much* better
comment: I have been using the web service for a few months now, after testing both the ios client and the android client, the android client leaves much to be desired.  the iOS client is well designed, fast as all get-out but the android client is slow, stutters, hiccups in both rendering views as well as fetching new data. it's gotten better with the most recent updates (solved lots of speed problems changing views). there is no tablet mode multi-pane view like there is on ios, no matter what i do, the unread tab often contains read items that are grayed out. and if they are in the middle of the list, they are *not* skipped when you slide between the entries.  I'd also really love to see background syncing like greater, newsrob and others.  also the android client often seems to repeat news entries when you reach the end of the cached articles, it will start to replay the same 3-5 articles until it has cached new ones as if they were the next ones in the list. NewsBlur for android IS a pretty solid overall client to the web service, but it's not a good ui  if it were me, i'd toss the android version, then try to replicate the ios version on the android platform as faithfully as possible.

title: Awesome
comment: Best android newsreader and RSS tool in general.

title: Kinda buggy and slow
comment: If you are looking for reader replacement this is not it... yet. It is kind of slow, somewhat buggy, but at least it is text based and friendly towards those of us with hundreds of feeds.

title: Pretty much what I need
comment: When coupled with the desktop it's the best no nonsense newsreader that I was looking for.

title: The April 2013 update is great
comment: This update is great.  The application is much faster and many bugs were fixed.  Now you can save an item right from the application. I'm happy.

title: Better than 2 months ago.
comment: This app has gotten WAY better  since I tried it 2 months ago, however it still had issues marking as read and refreshing feeds for new items. Say I have 6 new items and just stays at loading forever. Keep working but way better for sure.

title: Useful app
comment: Great app with a few annoying bugs.

title: fantastic
comment: I tried Flip board and feedly and neither Compare to the sophistication of news blur

title: Works fine for me!
comment: Everything works, could use some polish, but the functionality is there.

title: Still needs more work for Android
comment: Paid for the service for a year. We'll see if things improve.

title: No way to mark something as unread
comment: I want to like this service, but there doesn't seem to be a way to mark a story as being unread. That's a dealbeaker for me. Guess I'll have to try another feed reader. :-(

title: Piece of junk
comment: Tried all of these so called replacements. If they cannot provide a simple mobilized version of the FULL story to fit onto the screen with adjustable text size, then they all get a fail from me. Mobile devices require this as an essential if not primary feature. gReader works well for me and are standing by their product after Google terminates.

title: Very nice overall experience
comment: Still has a few bugs, items sometimes only get marked as read only locally (after a refresh they reappear). Marking all as read fixes it, but still a minor annoyance.

title: Getting better by the day.
comment: Devs are attentive and it shows that they are working on it. This still lags a little behind Reader in dependability, but it is definitely a worthy replacement now if you haven't played with it in a while.

title: The Alternative to Google Reader
comment: The app still has some rough spots, but it is getting better and is already a competent replacement to Google Reader.

title: I can't log in
comment: I can't log in, it just gives the oh-so-helpfull error message of, "whoopsie, try again"

title: Duplicate feeds, sometimes quirky behavior
comment: Love the service, but the app needs some work. It shows my feeds multiple times even after deleting and re-adding them. Also shows more unread items than there are sometimes.
Latest update improves the app a lot!

title: Great with subscription
comment: A worthy replacement for Google Reader and buying a subscription helps ensure the app won't get shut down like Google Reader.

title: Even better than Reader
comment: Completely eliminates any sad feelings I had from hearing Reader's shutting down.

title: Update really improves app
comment: This app has been a work in progress for a while, but the latest update was a huge step in the right direction. There are still quirks, like feeds I deleted ages ago suddenly showing up again only in the android app, but the main point is that the app is now ready to take over for google reader.

title: Excellent app
comment: The recent updates really improved performance and crashes. Finally ready to divorce Google Reader.
Constantly crashes

title: Force closing all the time
comment: Force closes every time I search for feed. Sony xperia z

title: Great app! Just missing a couple of things..
comment: Great job, Sam and Ryan!  I love Newsblur, and am excited to have social RSS back in my life.

title: Crashy
comment: Crashes on my SGS3. Also fails to load stories that are already set up correctly in the web app. Have submitted crash reports but there's no way to find answers to not loading stories. Feedly, an alternative app, works correctly.

title: Average UI
comment: No option to mark as read on scroll-past. Could use a widget.

title: Improved a bit after updates.
comment: After recent updates it now no longer *constantly* crashes. Still limited in functionality though (no apparent way to mark as unread or to do intelligence training.)

title: Not bad
comment: Very fast. Would love to see some reading options like dark/light theme, a more compact view and may be some customization with the lists. Still a solid app and the better option if you're using Newsblur on a mobile device.

title: Needs a way to view "full article" in-app
comment: I love Newsblur, but it's really a big missing feature to not be able to view the web version of the article in the app. Other RSS apps can show the original article and even clean it up for easier reading on a phone. This is really the only thing that keeps me from using Newsblur on my phone. It's great on the web, but the mobile version is lacking.

title: Problem syncing content
comment: The items I read on the app are not synced to the website

title: Love it
comment: Have used for a few months. Web app is stunning, and the Android app keeps improving.

title: Much improved, still need "mark as unread!!!"
comment: This app works MUCH better since the recent updates, but why give us the option to mark as read with no option to mark as unread????

title: Really poor options
comment: I would recommend copying greader.

title: syncing extremely inconsistent
comment: This is constantly out of sync with what's read on the web, or even read a previous day on the Android app. It's incredibly frustrating, and really wished this was fixed.

title: Newsblur has become a paid service
comment: "Due to overwhelming demand, free accounts are temporarily suspended.  By going premium you get full access to NewsBlur."  says the Newsblur service.  But it does so AFTER it accesses your Google Reader feeds.

title: Finally stable...
comment: ....but still missing key features from the web version. Viewing saved articles or the learn function I've come to love.

title: Great RSS Reader
comment: NewsBlur is a great platform to replace Google Reader. The web app in itself is worth the price of a yearly premium subscription and the fact that there are companion apps for Android and iPhone makes it all the better.  The latest version of the Android app is fast and syncs perfectly across all devices.

title: Wonderful App for NewsBlur service
comment: This is a great app that links to my NewsBlur eds feed aggregator service that I pay for. With Google Reader shutting down in June 2013, NewsBlur has been the perfect replacement for my RSS feed aggregating/reading needs. I am also more than happy to pay for the service to give it a much better chance of not shutting down out of the blue like Google Reader.  Highly recommended app for NewsBlur subscribers!

title: The latest update is pretty stable but missing key feature
comment: The new update is much more stable. I love the Newsblur website, but I am sticking with an alternative service and app until the Newsblur app allows me to see the list of stories that I have saved. The new app update added the ability to save from the app, but I think it would be more useful if a long press on the story title in the summary list had the save for later option. I often browse through headlines and don't like having to open a story to save it for later.

title: Great update
comment: But please please please can we have a widget?

title: I tried
comment: All this app does is give me "Overloaded, no auto complete results." error when I try to add a feed. Still looking for a usable Reader replacement.

Adrian, The feed add/search functionality is currently disabled from the Android version. Please try adding your feeds via the web version until we can re-enable this feature in Android.  Sorry about the inconvenience.

title: Performance fixed
comment: Latest version has fixed all of the performance problems. Solid reader

title: 1.2 works great
comment: Just needs some visual configuration, fonts etc...

title: Just one problem
comment: On my s3 I still can't load All Stories.   Occasionally stories don't stay unread.
Crashes all the time on my HTC One S

title: Constant crashes
comment: Heard a good recommendation for this, but it's completely unusable on my nexus 7.

title: Works but needs widget!
comment: This app seems to work fine. I'll likely use it but it is in dire need of a good widget! I'll miss google reader. :(

title: Very primitive app
comment: No night reading mode, no choice of font size... I'd pay the premium price tag if this app was as good as gReader.

title: Slow sync and double display
comment: Pretty good app except sync is slower than what I'm used to in Google Reader.  That is to say that feeds don't update as quickly.  Also the last feed is displayed multiple times.  This doesn't seem to affect functionality though.
Cannot login :(

title: Worthless
comment: Cannot even connect to its own site

title: Can't add feed
comment: App works well,  but crashes every time I add a feed from the app. I add feeds from the website for now.

title: crash every time when I use it
comment: galaxy nexus 4.2.2

title: Works well, but need more options
comment: It works both on my Nexus 4 and Nexus 7.  It only crashed once when I am trying to view a already-read item during refresh, with filter on "unread".  The experience is considerably better on the larger Nexus 7.  The fonts and spacing are too wasteful for a phone screen.  I think the Google Reader App shows double amount of content without sacrificing any readability.  Your app should take a note from that.    In addition, the tags also wastes space.  I don't use them, but they can take three lines of precious screen space for some articles on my Nexus 4.  It's really bad that some articles use half of the screen for title + tags.  Please provide an option to disable that.  Finally, why can't I view already-read items in folders?  If I go to individual feeds, those items will be show in grey (assume I have "all" filter on).  But I get a "loading stories..." screen forever in "all stories" or any folder.

title: 'Loading'
comment: Don't seem to ever get past that point. Stories never come up.

title: Not working
comment: The android app is not loading any feeds and the web app is not friendly!

title: Works great for me
comment: No crashes, syncs just fine. Occasionally the unread count is off, but not a huge issue.

title: Looks nice
comment: Worked well for me. Can be considered as a replacement of google reader.

title: Not working
comment: Wanted to try this because of the eventual demise of Google Reader.  I can't get any feeds to load and it has frequently crashed and become unresponsive.  Hope this can be fixed.

title: Unresponsive & Broken
comment: App never loads stories and constantly crashes on my Nexus 7. Website seems to work fine, but the design and user experience is terrible (imo).

title: Great app
comment: Works great on nexus 4. Great alternative to Google reader.

title: Crashes
comment: Doesn't work. Crashes almost immediately upon opening.

title: Better
comment: Better since the party update, only feature missing is an option to automatically mark as read as I scroll through a list of articles, so I don't have to open each one.

title: Great
comment: I'm practically in love with NewsBlur.

title: Pretty sweet update
comment: Woo! Marking all as read works now!

title: Working Smoothly
comment: The update fixed a lot of issues I've had earlier and the upgrades to the server are making a definite improvement in response time.

title: Crashes
comment: It crashes on my Kindle Fire, it doesn't even pull the feeds

title: No "mark as unread"
comment: ...which is a deal breaker. Mobile reading is when I'm most likely to need that feature!  I also find the way the feeds are presented kind of confusing. It's not as clear as it should be which ones are unread.

title: I was going to upgrade my account but...
comment: The app always shows everything as read. The app also had issues updating my feed. I'm thinking that I should look at other alternatives.

title: Crashes
comment: Can't add feed, keeps crashing

title: Crude
comment: Not impressive compared to Press or Feedly

title: Useless
comment: Just downloaded, won't allow to add feed, force closes each time. Tried uninstalling and redownloading,but nothing works.

title: Crashes
comment: Touch your screen and it crashes...

title: Crashes... unuseable
comment: Sorry, but it crashes every time, everywhere. Uninstalling, might give it a try in a few months if/when I've had enough of Feedly, because I did like the layout for the brief periods of time that it allowed me to see it... before crashing again.

title: Disappointing
comment: When I can see the app, it looks like it may have potential, but most of the time it crashes, constantly.  I never really get to try anything out before it crashes.  Uninstalled.  May try it again after an update, but right now it's useless.

title: Fail
comment: Does not start

title: Mark as Unread?
comment: Not a bad app, and potentially a decent Google Reader replacement, but the lack of "Mark as Unread" and/or favorite controls ruin it for me for now.  The web site has that option, why not the mobile app?

title: A really slick piece of crap
comment: Not sure if I can forgive them and try again later.

title: Better than people say
comment: It's not perfect but it syncs fine, looks good and allows you to set focused tags. Beware of marking all as read in the all folder. That does lead to a crash.

title: FC when searching
comment: And 12 item limit.

title: Good start, but buggy
comment: This could be a good alternative to Google Reader in the future if some of the bugs are fixed. It's very attractive and functional. I haven't seen the crashes others have reported, but I do see the same feed and folder appear multiple times in the list. A "mark all previous read" option would be useful, as well.  I'd be more willing to overlook the bugs and buy a subscription if the developer showed some commitment to fixing them. Four months and a bunch of negative reviews, and yet there's no updated version?

title: Almost worthless
comment: Shows multiple copies of the same feeds.  Only occasionally marks things as read after viewing.  Crashes regularly.

title: Wish was a bit more refined
comment: Unforunately all feeds list in one generic folder which is very frastrating as it makes it difficult to find specific posts, however in firefox works perfectly and it sync's well with andoid.  And no longer any free accounts must pay $24 to use!

title: Better on the Web or iPad
comment: The Android version seems like it's been neglected. Certain buttons seem to have no effect but to force the app to crash. Further, you cannot separate feeds. That's right--you have to read all new stories at once. And I'm not sure if you can even review previously read stories. All in all, the web and iPad versions are better, so I'm waiting for an Android one to follow suit since this is a decent replacement for Reader.

title: Give it a time
comment: My HTC reported also "Forced close"  but problem was that I had no subscriptions. I import feeds from GReader through browser and all working fine.  Give him time, it's one person project, but best I have found (without images like Feedly, Flippoard or Pulse). Think I switch to that when GReader closes.

title: Beautiful.  Crashes.  Sync issues
comment: Beautiful UI.  Crashes several times a day.  Does not sync well with web service on desktop.  I am a heavy RSS user.  I paid for this premium service.

title: Constant app force-close and poor integration
comment: No thanks. Bye....

title: Not as good as Google Reader
comment: Like a lot of users, I came to NewsBlur after the announcement of Google Reader's coming demise. Whilst I'm finding the website actually superior to Google Reader in many ways once the initial culture shock has worn off, sadly the same is not true of the app. Saving and sharing stories is nowhere near as intuitive as GR's starring system, and there is seemingly no way to mark all stories as read, so that they keep on building up until you can get to your PC. Not yet fit for purpose.
Doesn't work

title: Does it work?
comment: You tell me!  Crashes every time I try and use it!
Slowwww

title: Terrible
comment: Crashes constantly

title: Bugs
comment: Some serious flaws. No option to sort by oldest, lot of force closes, only loads limited number of articles at a time before having to click back out to root menu. Needs work. Will hang on. Premium subscription member.

title: Shame
comment: It has promise, but constantly force closes. Only 12 feeds without subscription. With Google Reader going will try again in a few months.

title: It's not working for some reason ..
comment: Please fix it, it is not working, not loading anything and it is crashing...

title: Crashy as hell
comment: Couldn't even get to where I saw a single feed

title: Oh my...
comment: I don't think I've ever seen an app crash so fast and so frequently. S3.

title: Doesn't work
comment: It constantly is loading.   No content ever shows.
Crashes.

title: Crashes
comment: Couldn't even set it up before it started crashing on my HTC Rezound.

title: Unusable
comment: Constantly crashes

title: Good service, but premature app.
comment: This app crashes so many times on my Nexus 7 that I really haven't been able to use it much. And worse, when I'm not even using it, it keeps alerting me that it is crashing via popups over other apps. The biggest offending action on my part seems to be searching for a new feed to add. This action has never completed successfully for me, and always results in a gory series of crashes.  I will continue to use Newsblur online and will keep checking back for updates to the Android app.

title: Amazing black screen generator
comment: Tired of an annoying screen. Install Newsblur. Every button you click generates a black screen. And with a cute message "unfortunately Newsblur has stopped" Suo convenient!

title: Nearly unusable
comment: Feeds load extremely slowly. Failed to import Google Reader feeds. Crashed. Needs a lot of work functionally.

title: alpha stage
comment: need dark theme, mark unread command, img view, and most important full TEXT fetching without browser open and in the background!

title: Buggy
comment: Bugs all around. Unusable.

title: Only 12 feeds.
comment: Why would I buy the pro version just to get a functional RSS reader?

title: Crashes frequently
comment: Every time I try to mark all items in a folder as read, the app crashes on my Galaxy S3.

title: Didn't work
comment: Just said unable to connect to server. Installed within 3 minutes of installing.

title: Never logs in
comment: Crashed on first attempt to register, hmm

title: Too many crashes
comment: Registered and it crashed. After I brought it back up it crashed again almost immediately.

title: Crashes constantly on galaxy note
comment: Shame, as I've heard good things from users on other devices. :(

title: Not a fan
comment: Slow and clunky. Can't imagine how worse it can get when reader is officially gone...

title: Crashes
comment: I need a new reader now Google is closing down this looked good but crashes all the time

title: Unstable
comment: Constantly crashes. Even the web interface is unreliable. I really hope this gets fixed.

title: Crashes
comment: Logged in...crash. Reopened to find myself logged in, clicked the top right user icon...crash. Clicked back button in top left during new feed search...crash. Glad I tried the app before paying for premium access. The app does look good, too bad all the money went on the ui instead of the code.

title: Does nothing but crashes!
comment: Uninstalled!

title: Couldn't connect server
comment: Error on both android and web. Can't connect to server.

title: Please fix the problems
comment: The app crashes.

title: Won't get past the Google Reader loading section without crashing.
comment: Looked promising, but constantly crashes!

title: Crash app
comment: Does this app do anything besides crash?

title: Crashes
comment: Crashes before I can register.  Google, please don't do away with Reader.

title: Unstable
comment: I've had the app for less than a minute and its already crashed twice. Not too impressive.

title: Nope
comment: Crashes at the drop of a hat.

title: Crashes on nexus7
comment: Endless loading, then crashes !

title: Slow laggy crashes
comment: And wouldn't import from Google reader. Vzw Galaxy Nexus running 4.2

title: Better than Google reader
comment: Or at least i hope so.

title: Needs more polishing
comment: Newsblur is an awesome RSS service with some very handy features, that you will miss in Google Reader. It works, but many features from the Desktop or iOS app are still missing. If you get those, it's a 5 star app ;)

title: It don't look like the previews
comment: Until it's got Google reader, its not much good to me, I don't want somebody else picking my news stories

title: Some crashes but otherwise excellent
comment: Crashed on launch when I entered incorrect username.  Crashes when marking "All Storeis" as all read.  But otherwise excellent, and after just a few hours of use I already prefer it to Google Reader.

title: Not there yet...
comment: For some reason my feeds added on the site do not appear as separate folders, I only get one folder with all feeds. Additionally a tablet optimised interface might be nice. Also seems to crash when marking all as read. Apart from these problems, the interface is nice.

title: New issue
comment: Latest update crashes on launch.

title: Crashes
comment: I installed the latest update a few hours ago and now the app immediately crashes after launch on Android 4.2.

title: Full of bugs, still a long way to go
comment: Nice project but still beta quality.

title: Good start....
comment: .... But doesn't seem to function as stated. If there's a way to add Google Reader feeds, I'm unable to find it. Will change review as things develop.
A pleasure to use

title: What GReader Could Have Been
comment: Android app is still maturing, but the core NewsBlur experience is by far the best way to read feeds.  Dev is responsive to the community!

title: Good for the first release.
comment: Great to finally have a official Newsblur app for android, there are some issues however, for example all my feeds appear multiple times. There is no way to access saved stories. When these issues are fixed, this will be a five star app!

title: Beautiful piece of software
comment: I would suggest the following improvements:  Ability to change font size.  Mouseover text support so we can read xkcd and other comics with mouseover text.

title: Fantastic!
comment: Really nice app for all your RSS needs.

title: Yessssss!!!
comment: This is so beautiful.  I have been waiting for this for a while, but I do have to echo Ryan - without Mark as Unread, it's not really something I can use right now.  I often go through feeds on my phone/tablet to clear things out and mark the things I want to read later as unread.  Love the swipe to go to next article, though.  That has been sorely missing from Blar, the formerly sole Android app for NB.
